GOP platform takes tough stance against abortion

A GOP panel approved a platform draft today calling for a constitutional amendment outlawing abortion with no exceptions for cases of rape or incest. (Globe, 2:50 p.m.)

  • Mitt Romney's cash advantage grows

Akin vows to stay in race, calls response to rape comments 'overreaction'

Rep. Todd Akin is pressing ahead, calling the uproar over his remarks that women's bodies can stop pregnancies in case of "legitimate rape" an overreaction. (AP, 1:57 p.m.)

Teen killed, 3 injured in Kingston crash

Police said the driver of an SUV lost control on Elm Street last night leaving one 19-year-old male dead and three others hospitalized. (Globe, 9:05 a.m.)

Lesley-Barnes murder photo released

Boston have released a surveillance photo taken when Rashad Lesley-Barnes was fatally stabbed on a Roxbury street last week. (Boston Globe, 11:26 a.m.)

Thanks to broken lines of communication, what was once a model organization is now marked by distrust and the inability of Boston Red Sox executives, coaches, and players to work cohesively. (Globe)
